Write-Up Text: Social media users are buzzing about Australia's upcoming federal budget. The controversial Gillard-era parenting policy is set to be removed while new data suggests there is a crisis in the funeral insurance industry garnering calls for change. Private companies family businesses and mid-market organizations are being encouraged to share their thoughts on the economy tax and business challenges. However some individuals are unhappy with other potential new reforms such as the introduction of a 60-day dispensation while others have mocked the ubiquity of the phrase "hard decisions" and are urgeing politicians to invest in families. All of these issues have sparked deep conversations and debates on social media platforms under the #auspol and #budget hashtags.
